title: Malware Sample Break Down
content: This is a test of a live upload directly from a Github API point for security news articles

title: NoName057(16) Claims DDoS Attack on Ukrainian Websites
content:
NoName057(16) has announced that they, along with several allied hacker groups, carried out a series of cyberattacks on 111 Ukrainian websites, which they claim are linked to what they describe as the “criminal regime of the terrorist Zelensky.” The group alleges that between August 8th and today, they were responsible for 84 of these attacks.

According to NoName057(16), the cyberattacks targeted key sectors of the Ukrainian economy, including government and administrative sites, the military-industrial complex, telecommunications, banking and finance, industry, media and social media, the fuel and energy complex, as well as transport and logistics.

The hackers claim that this coordinated attack involved multiple groups, including People’s Cyber Army, OverFlame, HackNeT, RTF, and Anonymous Guys. These claims have not been independently verified and remain allegations made by the group.

title: NoName057(16) Allegedly Targeted Ukraine After Ukrainian Offensive Towards Kursk Oblast
content:
A threat actor under the alias NoName057(16) shared a message about an alleged cyber attack towards Ukrainian targets.

In the message published by the threat actor there is a description of recent movements of the Ukrainian and Russian armed forces. After describing the latest clashes, the threat actor lists the alleged victims of their cyber attacks which are various Ukrainian institutions and infrastructure entities.

The alleged victims are as follows:

  • Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food of Ukraine
  • “Lvovoblenergo” provision of electricity distribution services
  • API of Lvivoblenergo website
  • Kiev Metro
  • Information portal of the city of Kiev
  • AT “UKRSIBBANK” Commercial Bank of Ukraine
  • “UKRSIBBANK” Consumer Finance IT-platform
  • UKRSIB internet banking
  • “UKRSIBANK” Qualified provider of electronic trust services accredited key certification center
  • System “UKRSIB business” Personal cabinet (two different Checkhost links)
  • Accordbank

title: National Curry Awards Allegedly Targeted by Moroccan Threat Actors
content:
A threat actor under the moniker Moroccan Cyber Forces in cooperation with another threat actor under the alias Moroccan Soldiers has claimed responsibility for an alleged cyber attack on the website of the National Curry Awards, a prominent event promoting the businesses of the Asian catering industry as well as highlighting its creative and talented chefs in the United Kingdom. The group justified their alleged cyberattack by accusing the British government of supporting Zionist actions in Palestine, which they denounce as genocide.

A couple of days before this alleged cyber attack, the two threat actors published their cooperation via Telegram stating that they will be in an alliance in order to strengthen Moroccan cyber security and defend Morocco, the Palestinian issue, and all Arab Islamic issues.

title: LulzSec Muslims Allegedly Targeting Argentina
content:
According to the Telegram messages shared by the threat actor, organizations in Argentina was targeted by them. The alleged attacks occurred as a support for Palestine.

The messages states that the largest news platform in Argentina which is owned by A-Piv and Ministry of Health of the Argentine Republic, specifically for the management of the Affidavit of Signature and Functions (DJFF) for health professionals were targeted.

According to the threat actors, they were able to access patient data and their medical records and access to more than 219,155 personal data. They didn’t share the data because according to their statement they were not comfortable leaking the data of citizens who have nothing to do with their country’s policies.

The threat actor didn’t share the data but they shared screenshots from their alleged attacks.

title: SN_BLACKMETA Group Claims DDoS Attack on Europol’s Website
content:
Europol, the European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation, which plays a crucial role in coordinating and enhancing cooperation among police forces in EU member states to combat organized crime and terrorism, has recently been targeted by a cyberattack. The SN_BLACKMETA group has claimed responsibility for a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack on Europol’s website, asserting that they have significantly disrupted the agency’s online services.

The attackers boasted about their actions, stating, “We attacked all the systems + we burned the server and the network.” This claim was supported by the release of several screenshots and check reports, which were shared on various platforms to demonstrate the impact of their attack. The reports provided by SN_BLACKMETA can be found at the following links:

  • Check Report 1
  • Check Report 2
  • Check Report 3
  • Check Report 4
  • Check Report 5

These reports detail the alleged disruptions caused by the attack, including significant downtime and server instability. While Europol has not yet confirmed the full extent of the attack’s impact, the incident underscores the growing threat of cyberattacks on critical institutions.

title: KozSec Allegedly Targeting Ukraine and Supporting Russia
content:
The threat actor under the moniker KozSec is now supporting Russia according to the message they shared on their Telegram channel.

After declaring their solidarity with Russia, the threat actor emphasized their actions as defensive measures to protect Russian interests against perceived Western encroachments. According to the message, their alleged attacks on Ukrainian infrastructure are not acts of aggression but rather defensive maneuvers aimed at countering the influence of NATO and protecting Russia.

Afterwards, the threat actor shared a message, claiming to have attacked Vodafone Ukraine. This alleged disruption affected 65,536 IP addresses and caused several domains to go down according to the message. KozSec framed this attack as a stance against current geopolitical tensions.

title: Hackers Allegedly Targeted Czech Organizations After Defense Minister Statement
content:
Several threat actors, predominantly of Russian origin, allegedly have intensified their activities against organizations in the Czech Republic following the announcement by Czech Defense Minister Jana Černochová regarding the establishment of a “Ukrainian legion”.

Народная CyberАрмия, NoName057(16), Azzasec, and Khalifa Hackers are among the attackers. The allegations about their cyberattacks are published on their Telegram channels.

Alleged attacks targeted the following organizations:

Народная CyberАрмия

  • ELDIS Radar Systems, a radar manufacturer for both civilian and military purposes.
  • KARBOX, a company producing superstructures for trucks and special vehicles designed for both civilian and military use.

NoName057(16)

  • Authorization on the CSA airline portal
  • Authorization on the portal of Information System Application Support for Audit Authority
  • Authorization on the portal of the Chamber of Tax Consultants of the Czech Republic (two different Checkhost links)
  • API National Transportation Information Center
  • Selection procedure, civil service examination
  • Authorization on the Czech Army portal
  • 25th Air Defense Missile Regiment
  • Authorization at Euroclear (two different Checkhost links)
  • Ministry of Agriculture of the Czech Republic
  • Authorization on the portal of the Ministry of Agriculture of the Czech Republic

Azzasec

  • Road Directorate of the Zlín Region
  • Management and maintenance of Zlínska roads

Khalifa Hackers

Local Search Engines and Directories:

  • Seznam.cz: A popular Czech search engine and web portal.
  • Firmy.cz: A business directory associated with Seznam.cz.
  • Najisto.cz: Another business directory under the Seznam.cz umbrella.

General Business Directories:

  • CzechTrade: A government agency promoting trade, which includes a directory of Czech companies.
  • Kompass: An international business directory with a section for Czech companies.

Industry-Specific Directories:

  • Czech Chamber of Commerce: Lists members and provides links to their websites.
  • CzechTourism: Lists tourism-related businesses like hotels, restaurants, and attractions.

Academic and Government Institutions:

  • CZ.NIC: The registry for the .cz domain, which might provide lists of registered domains.
  • Czech Universities: Websites of major universities like Charles University, Czech Technical University, etc.

title: DarkMeta Allegedly Targeted Israeli Organizations
content:
According to the Telegram messages the threat actor published on their channel, the hacking group targeted Israeli organizations. Bank Yahav and Bank Massad were some of the targeted organizations by the threat actor.

They also published Checkhost links as well as screenshots to improve the credibility of their alleged attack.

According to the Telegram message, Bank Yahav’s following services were impacted:

  • Online Banking Services
  • Secure login access
  • Account management
  • Transaction history
  • Payments and transfers
  • Additional online banking features

Additionally, the alleged attacks impacted the following organizations:

  • online[.]bankmassad.co.il
  • online[.]bankotsar.co.il
  • online[.]fibi.co.il
  • online[.]pagi.co.il
  • www[.]bankmassad.co.il
  • www[.]bankotsar.co.il
  • www[.]fibi.co.il
  • www[.]pagi.co.il

title: Arrests Spark Surge in Cyber Attacks on Spanish Organizations
content:
Threat actors are still targeting Spanish organizations due to the recent arrest of two cybercriminals linked to NoName057(16). Threat actors have been targeting both public and private groups for a while now, and NoName057(16) as well as Server Killers have revealed their latest purported assaults on their Telegram channels.

According to the messages, the following organizations were targeted:

  • Official website of the Government of Spain
  • The website of the Spanish Ministry of Transportation
  • Spain’s Ministry of Finance
  • Palma de Mallorca Port
  • The Port of Huelva
  • Zaragoza City Council
  • Murcia City Council Housing Service
  • Ruma (a company produces deli products)
  • Canal de Isabel II (a company that manages the water supply for Madrid, Spain)
    • Vendor portal on Canal de Isabel II website
    • Access to virtual office
    • Tender portal of the Canal de Isabel II Group

title: Unidentified Group Claims Access to Spain’s Pipeline Systems, Warns of Potential Destruction
content:
Unidentified group has announced that it has gained unauthorized access to the pipeline systems in Spain. According to statements made by the group, they currently maintain persistent access to these systems but have not yet caused any damage. However, they warn that they possess the capability to inflict widespread destruction if they choose to do so.

The group further declared their intention to continue targeting countries affiliated with NATO, suggesting a broader agenda beyond this specific breach. The situation raises concerns about the vulnerability of critical infrastructure and the potential for future cyber-attacks against NATO member states.

title: Threat Actor Claims Sale of Dell Database Containing 49 Million Customer Records
content:
Reports emerge of a significant security breach as a threat actor alleges to be selling a database purportedly containing 49 million customer records from Dell, a leading technology company. The alleged data encompasses information on systems purchased from Dell between 2017 and 2024, comprising a comprehensive repository of customer details.

The data, claimed to be up-to-date information registered at Dell servers, includes vital personal and company information such as full names, addresses, cities, provinces, postal codes, countries, unique 7-digit service tags of systems, system shipment dates (warranty start), warranty plans, serial numbers (for monitors), Dell customer numbers, and Dell order numbers. Notably, the threat actor asserts to be the sole possessor of this data, underscoring the severity of the breach. Among the staggering number of records, approximately 7 million rows pertain to individual/personal purchases, while 11 million belong to consumer segment companies. The remaining data pertains to enterprise, partner, schools, or unidentified entities. Furthermore, the threat actor highlights the top five countries with the most systems represented in the database, including the United States, China, India, Australia, and Canada. This revelation raises significant concerns regarding the security and privacy of Dell customers’ information, prompting urgent action to mitigate potential risks and prevent further unauthorized access.

title: Threat Actor Claims to Have Leaked Database Containing Personal Information of 5 Million Salvadoran Citizens
content: A threat actor has purportedly leaked a database containing the personal information and photos of 5 million Salvadoran citizens in El Salvador. According to the threat actor, the leaked data consists of 5,129,518 high-definition photos without watermarks, each labeled with the individual’s “DUI” identification number, totaling 144 GB in size. Additionally, the leaked database includes comprehensive citizen information, including identification document (DUI) numbers, names, last names, dates of birth, telephone numbers, email addresses, and residential addresses. This release follows a previous attempt to sell the data, with the threat actor now making it available for free.

title: Threat Actor Claims Sale of State Grid Corporation of China (SGCC) Data, World’s Largest Utility Company
content:
A threat actor has claimed to have recently gained access to a third-party system, thereby acquiring sensitive information belonging to the State Grid Corporation of China (SGCC). SGCC is a state-owned electric utility corporation and the largest utility company in the world.

The alleged data breach includes several categories of information, such as corporate user accounts, user information, department details, and roles. The compromised data reportedly contains information on thousands of employees, including their eIDs, usernames, phone numbers, emails, employee numbers, and passwords.

The threat actor is offering this data for sale at $1000, with escrow services involved to facilitate the transaction. The data is available in SQL and XLSX formats.

For inquiries, the threat actor has provided contact details on Telegram.

The breach of such sensitive information from a major utility company like SGCC highlights the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures. As this situation develops, it will be important to monitor the potential implications for both the corporation and its employees.

title: New ATM Malware Threatens European Banking Security
content:
A highly alarming new type of ATM malware has emerged in Europe, boasting an unprecedented 99% success rate. Dubbed “EU ATM Malware”. This malicious software has the potential to compromise almost any ATM in Europe and approximately 60% of ATMs worldwide, posing a significant threat to global banking security. The malware is reportedly capable of targeting ATMs manufactured by leading companies such as Diebold Nixdorf, Hyosung, Oki, Bank of America, NCR, GRG, and Hitachi, among others.

 

The developers of this malware claim that it can generate up to $30,000 per ATM, making it a lucrative tool for cybercriminals. The malware is fully automated, simplifying its deployment and operation. However, it also includes a manual operation mode for those who prefer a hands-on approach.

 

The malware is being sold with flexible payment options, including:

  • A monthly subscription.
  • A test payload option valid for three days.
  • An initial fee plus a share of the profits from successful jackpotting operations.

The European banking sector, known for its stringent security measures, now faces a formidable challenge in safeguarding its ATM infrastructure against this advanced and pervasive threat.

title: CyberNiggers Group Allegedly Breaches HSBC and Barclays Banks, Compromising Extensive Databases and Source Code
content:
The CyberNiggers group has asserted its infiltration into the security systems of HSBC and Barclays banks, allegedly orchestrated by members Sanggiero and IntelBroker. The breach has led to the compromise of extensive databases. Among these datasets are notary_request_2024.csv, boasting 512K lines, ledger_summary_2024.csv with 241K lines, _transaction__2024.csv containing a staggering 1 million lines, and notification_2024.csv with 501K lines. Each of these files delineates crucial aspects of banking operations, offering insight into transaction records, account details, and user notifications.

Beyond these primary databases, the cyber assailants claim to have accessed a trove of additional files, including security certificates, PIX keys, JKS files, security signing keys, and compiled .Jar files. Furthermore, they boast of acquiring source code extracted from the GitLab repository, exacerbating the severity of the breach. Additionally, the hackers assert control over miscellaneous unsorted documents, suggesting a comprehensive infiltration into the banks’ digital infrastructure. This brazen act underscores the growing sophistication and audacity of cyber threats facing the global financial sector.

title: Threat Actor Claims to Sell Data of Active Duty Personnel from Three US Military Branches
content:
A threat actor has announced the sale of three separate leaks containing data of active duty personnel from three branches of the US Military: the Air Force, Navy, and Army.

Details of the Alleged Leaks:

  • Branches Affected:
    • Air Force: 9,450 personnel
    • Navy: 8,681 personnel
    • Army: 5,571 personnel
  • Data Headers:
    • ID
    • Name
    • Title
    • Email
    • Phone
    • Units
  • Date of the Leak: July 2024
  • Price: Negotiable

The sale of this sensitive information poses significant security risks and underscores the need for enhanced cybersecurity measures within military organizations. The threat actor is inviting potential buyers to negotiate the price, indicating the high value and sensitivity of the data.

title: Manila Health Department Allegedly Breached, Sensitive Patient and Employee Records Exposed
content:
A threat actor claims to have leaked a database from the Manila Health Department, containing sensitive patient and employee records. The compromised data reportedly includes usernames, names, dates of birth, appointment details, and 19,000 unique email addresses.

According to the threat actor, the breach occurred in July 2024 and was initially brought to attention by a group called “The Nexus Squad.” The stolen data was subsequently listed for sale on a prominent hacking forum. In addition to the personal information, the breach also exposed passwords in MD5 hash format, further heightening security concerns.

The exposed database includes detailed patient records with fields such as ID, username, password, role, first and last names, health center affiliations, email addresses, dates of birth, and more. The breach represents a significant compromise of the Manila Health Department’s services, raising serious concerns about the protection of sensitive health information in the region.

title: Anonymous Collective Targets Egypt Over Gaza Crisis, Launches DDoS Attacks on Key Websites
content:
In a recent announcement, the Anonymous Collective declared its intent to target Egypt for its perceived failure to aid Gaza refugees in need. The group’s reprisal took the form of DDoS attacks on key Egyptian websites, including the official portal of Cairo International Airport and the Egypt Post, which manages the country’s postal services.

The group’s statement underscored its dissatisfaction with Egypt’s alleged lack of support for Gaza refugees, accusing the nation of siding with what it terms the “Zionist enemy” and closing its borders instead of offering assistance. With a rallying cry of “ESCALATE FOR PALESTINE,” Anonymous Collective signaled its determination to hold Egypt accountable for its actions regarding the ongoing situation in Gaza.
